info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 8:05PM EDT until August 12 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON...SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON AND NORTHEASTERN BELMONT COUNTIES... At 805 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near St. Clairsville, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... St. Clairsville, Tiltonsville, Yorkville, Adena, Dillonvale, Mount Pleasant, Rayland, Neffs, Harrisville, and Barkcamp State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
